entry.title: How to catch a bat
entry.summary:
Author: VHdeadinside

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 19,367Chapters: 5/?Kudos: 135

Summary: In a world where Batman never revealed his identity and everyone remains ignorant in the league, even though all the Robins are around and clearly the younger ones know who Batman is, Batman gets spotted leaving Wayne Manor and is apparently dating Bruce. Naturally this breaks poor Clark Kent's heart but all he can do is move on so long as Batman is happy. Except for the fact that Batman is never happy unless Superman is near him, so the idea of Clark suddenly dating men drive Batman insane, all the while Clark is nursing a poor broken heart with the support of the original league.

entry.title: I've Got All This Ringing In My Ears And None On My Fingers
entry.summary:
Author: saintsforgrrrls

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,619Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 52

Summary: Music matches your soul. Bruce hates his own tune while Clark finds it as the most beautiful thing to bless his ears.-----Hal’s hand mocked him, his thumb and the rest of his fingers imitating John’s mouth. “Big Blue’s Kryptonian traditional crystal music. That’s a mouthful. Princess, over there, has a crazy opera gig going on.” He explained, pointing at everyone who stood around the Green Lanterns.Barry and Bruce were the outliers, choosing to continue sitting at the table. Or rather, Bruce was sitting in the chair while Barry sat on top of the large circular table near him while emitting his music. He didn’t want to be mean and leave Bruce at the table by himself.“Fish boy has a whole...whale? Which is crazy considering he already controls most of the ocean so the sound is really on the nose-“ Hal began to ramble off to himself, absentmindedly waving his hand as he motioned John to continue it for him.

entry.title: The Two Clyties
entry.summary:
Author: harpsichordsandthelit

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,767Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 13

Summary: Bruce Wayne, a ruthless yet weary CEO at 27, has spent his life building walls around himself, his company, and his heart. Years ago, he won a bitter legal war against his corrupt uncle, reclaiming his inheritance, but the battle left him cold and isolated. That is, until he stumbles upon a poetry collection by the reclusive writer Seph. The raw grief and longing in Seph’s words resonate with him in a way nothing else has, igniting something in him that he thought had died long ago.And then he meet Clark Joseph Kent.

entry.summary:
Author: doomer416

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,474Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 43

Summary: Weariness dripping from his face, Bruce entered the watchtower and pried his cowl off. He had stood up late the night before, working away on a case that was neither imminent nor complicated. He simply needed an escape from the thoughts that swallowed him whole, and he broke free from them via occupying said thoughts with casework. entry.summary:
Author: even_atlas

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 6,603Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 58

Summary: Bruce tangles their fingers together, leading Clark through the kitchen and up the staircase. It’s a mirror of the first time they did this, six months ago. Clark is no less excited now than he was then. His love for Bruce has grown to the point of overflowing, until it feels like it’s shining through his pores. If Bruce asked for the moon and stars, Clark would do everything in his power to give them to him.“You’re thinking too much,” Bruce says as they reach the top of the staircase and start down the hall towards Bruce’s rooms.“Isn’t that my line?” Clark answers teasingly.
